thread.title: McNair heads latest Tennessee Sports Hall of Fame class - News Sentinel
thread.title_full: McNair heads latest Tennessee Sports Hall of Fame class - News Sentinel Story

author: The Associated Press
title: McNair heads latest Tennessee Sports Hall of Fame class - News Sentinel
text:
NASHVILLE, Tenn. (AP) â€” Former Tennessee Titans quarterback Steve McNair headlines a list of Tennessee Sports Hall of Fame selections to be inducted next summer.
The Hall of Fame announced Saturday that McNair would be inducted posthumously along with former high school golf coach King Oehmig on June 18 in Nashville. Former Tennessee football players Conrad Graham and Lester McClain, Olympic runner Missy Kane, Southeastern Conference football official Mike Taylor, former Memphis and NFL wide receiver Earnest Gray, auto racing owner Mike Curb, sportswriter Joe Biddle and the Canale brothers also will be inducted that day.
The Canale family of Memphis had six brothers who played SEC football at Tennessee or Mississippi State.
The Hall of Fame also will honor former Milligan coach, athlete and athletic director Duard Walker as a lifetime achievement inductee.
